H0.text: Volcanic eruption and lava flow are parts of the geologic process that changes metamorphic rock into sedimentary rock.

H1.text: Igneous intrusion and solidification are parts of the geologic process that changes metamorphic rock into sedimentary rock.

H2.text: Faulting and displacement are parts of the geologic process that changes metamorphic rock into sedimentary rock.

H3.text: Erosion and deposition are parts of the geologic process that changes metamorphic rock into sedimentary rock.

A4.text: All three types of rocks (igneous, sedimentary and metamorphic rocks) can be the source of sedimentary detritus.
